channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside 85 Gower St, 16th November
item.description:
This manhole cover is loose and rocking, so it makes a loud rattling noise every time a car drives over it. It's on Gower St, on the road, outside 85 Gower St. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gower Street, Bloomsbury, Camden Town, London Borough of Camden

item.title: Fly tipping, 16th November
item.description:
There seems to be a certain person/s Flytipping around this estate . Today i came across 2 builder sacks full of waste that has been fly tipped. Im sure this is the same person/s who has been fly tipping in the area for the last 2 months . It wouldn't take much for greenwich council to catch this person in the act. Its making the estate look like a dumping ground.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Flintmill Crescent, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Raised, rocking and broken paving between 24 & 26 Raymere Gardens

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Raymere Gardens, Plumstead

item.title: Camper van with multiple occupants, 16th November
item.description:
Parked overnight Saturday and tonight with people sleeping in it overnight. Moved temporarily during the day but returned at night,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hutton Road, Shenfield, Brentwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bricks in a foundation wall between Ellenbourgh Rd and northCray road have not been replaced properly after separation railing was damaged and replaced Some bricks now missing and others are falling on to pavement causing difficulties to pavement users some Bricks at hidden from view under piles of weeds and leaves, 16th November
item.description:
This problem has existed for some time, since the railing was damaged by a vehicle crashing into it, which had a temporary plastic cover to cover the damage. But when the railing section eventually arrived, the fitting team only connected it with four bolts to the other sections, but did not repair the railing legs back into the damaged red brick wall below. Maybe a second look may make the barrier railing 99 percent safe and not a source of danger to prams and mobility scooters and pedestrians alike
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Cray Road, North Cray, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste to be removed from planter outside Nando's, 16th November
item.description:
There has been a large roll of rubber from building works in the planter outside Nando's for weeks. Needs removing please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 119, Newington Causeway, Elephant and Castle, London Borough of Southwark

item.title: Fly tipping, 16th November
item.description:
The new sign is making no difference people are still dumping rubbish just the same.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, Crayford, Bexleyheath, London Borough of Bexley

item.title: Parkland being destroyed by vehicles driving on the grass, 16th November
item.description:
Previous Report reference: 8335658 (In progress) - Service Vehicles driving on park grass. This report was made on October 27th. The first image taken at that time. Three weeks later and as the new images show the grass has been totally destroyed and every day the mud from this damage is all over the public footpath. This is not only in this place in the park where this is happening its in other places anyone can see all over the park. If the issue is the vehicle is to big for the path the something needs to be done. Someone is going to have an accident slipping on the mud all over the footpath in all these areas. On top of that winter hasn't even begun and already we have lost the grass that recovered in the summer. May be a fence needs to be placed here to stop the contractors driving on the grass ? Please can you help. We understand they need to do their job in a timely manor however not at the detriment of the safety of the public and the preservation of our park land.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Road, Poverest, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling dirty roads, 16th November
item.description:

item.title: Street and footpath covered in leaves, which are very slipoy. The steep footpath is dangerously slippy due to leaves, 16th November
item.description:
The street is never cleaned. I regularly pick up litter but no roars sweeping is done. The drain at the top of the footpath is blocked with leaves and the steep footpath down to College Road is dangerously slippy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rock Hill, Dulwich, London Borough of Southwark

item.description:

item.title: Outside 98/100, 16th November
item.description:
There was an accumulation of leaves on our street. They were wet and slippery so a potential hazard. They were also blocking the gullies which caused flooding in previous years. I cleared the sidewalks and gullies and there are now three bags of leaves outside number 100. Please can you collect them. Thank you
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charteris Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
